render.tex: %text Meaning of a relation $R$ in sets $A$ and $B$ %

reason.tex: %text A relation in sets $A$ and $B$ is an arbitrary subset of $A\times B$ which satisfies some condition. Consider the sets $A=\{1,2\}$, and $B=\{5,6,7\}$. % \begin{align} A\times B =& \{1,5\}, \{1,6\}, \{1,7\}, \{2,5\}, \\ &\{2,6\},\{2,7\} \end{align} \\ %text If $R=\{(a,b):b=a+4\}$, not all the above pairs satisfy this condition. For instance, % \qquad \begin{align} \{1,6\}&\implies b=a+5 \\ \{2,5\}&\implies b=a+3 \end{align} \\ %text The only pair that satisfies the condition for the relation is $\{3,5\}$ $(\because 5=3+2)$. \therefore the relation $R$ from $A$ to $B$ is $\{3,5\}$. Note: A relation can also be in set $A$ alone. In this case, it would be a subset of $A\times A$. %
